messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 860
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 11/9/2000 7:35:58 AM Pacific Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 11/9/2000 7:35:58 AM Pacific Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:

<< I am fortunate to interact with a lot of Christian unschoolers. I
have been on two Christian unschooling groups and as an educational
philosophy it seems to be growing among Christians, though it will not
likely
catch up with the other approach any time soon. I have met people who are
very conservative in other aspects of their lives who have embraced
unschooling and are forming inclusive support groups. (I know you weren't
painting us all with the same brush, just want to say there is hope.) >>

I think it is a growing movement as well, which is why we wrote the book! LOL
My concern is that we become as accepted by our brothers and sisters in faith
as any other type of educational theory. We'll see. It is also my hope that
Christian unschoolers and relaxed homeschoolers and those nonchristian
home/unschoolers with open hearts will begin to heal the rifts that have
appeared between homeschoolers.
Teri


Co-author Christian Unschooling; Growing Your Child in the Freedom of Christ
Homeschooling - Christian Unschooling - Natural learning
http://www.inspirit.com.au/unschooling/
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
